abstract: An animation that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
overview:
## Return Value

An ease-in ease-out animation with the default duration.

## Discussion

An easing animation provides motion with a natural feel by varying the acceleration and deceleration of the animation, which matches how things tend to move in reality. An ease in and out animation starts slowly, increasing its speed towards the halfway point, and finally decreasing the speed towards the end of the animation.

The `easeInOut` animation has a default duration of 0.35 seconds. To specify the duration, use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Animation/easeInOut(duration:)] method.

The following code shows an example of animating the size changes of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Circle] using an ease in and out animation.

items.description: An animation that starts slowly and then increases speed towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeIn

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that starts slowly and then increases speed towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeIn(duration:)

items.description: An animation that starts quickly and then slows towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeOut

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that starts quickly and then slows towards the end of the movement.
items.name: easeOut(duration:)

items.description: An animation with a specified duration that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
items.name: easeInOut(duration:)

title: easeInOut
